item.title: Reseña de ‘El agente secreto’: la carnicería en tierra de carnaval
item.description: En su éxito más reciente, el cineasta Kleber Mendonça Filho adopta una sensibilidad desenfadada y encuentra la risa en medio del terror. Wagner Moura encarna a un hombre desesperado y melancólico.
item.dc:creator: Manohla Dargis

item.title: ‘One Battle After Another’ Wins Producers Guild Award. Is Oscar Next?
item.description: The Paul Thomas Anderson film also took the top Directors Guild prize as well, a good sign for the movie’s best picture prospects at the Oscars.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)

media:content.media:credit: Kevin Winter/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Paul Thomas Anderson, who, along with Sara Murphy, won the PGA for “One Battle After Another.”

item.title: Para Trump, el ataque a Irán es la guerra de elección fundamental
item.description: No existía una amenaza inmediata por parte de Irán. Pero el presidente vio la oportunidad de llevar al límite a un gobierno debilitado, y apuesta por desencadenar un levantamiento popular.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Iraníes atrapados en el tráfico en las autopistas tras las explosiones del sábado en Teherán.

item.title: Iran Got Trump All Wrong
item.description: We should not squander this moment, when Iran is uniquely weak and vulnerable and we hold all of the advantages — literally.
item.dc:creator: Kenneth F. McKenzie Jr.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Damon Winter/The New York Times

item.title: War and Peace Cannot Be Left to One Man — Especially Not This Man
item.description: The Constitution isn’t a technicality.
item.dc:creator: David French

media:content.media:credit: Photo illustration by Aleksey Kondratyev for The New York Times

item.title: In Texas, the Old, Kinder, Gentler G.O.P. Faces Its Alamo Moment
item.description: John Cornyn says his challenger doesn’t have the character to serve in the Senate. MAGA voters might not care.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Cottle

media:content.media:credit: Damon Winter/The New York Times

item.title: Trump’s War of Choice With Iran
item.description: Our national security correspondent David E. Sanger examines the war of choice that President Trump has initiated with Iran.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger, Gilad Thaler, Thomas Vollkommer and Laura Salaberry

item.title: The C.I.A. Helped Pinpoint a Gathering of Iranian Leaders. Then Israel Struck.
item.description: The killing of Iran’s supreme leader and other top Iranian officials came after close intelligence sharing between the United States and Israel, according to people familiar with the operation.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes, Ronen Bergman, Eric Schmitt and Tyler Pager
item.category: US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)

media:content.media:credit: Airbus, via Reuters
media:content.media:description: A satellite image shows black smoke rising and heavy damage at Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s compound, following strikes by the United States and Israel against Iran, on Saturday.

item.title: 40 Years and 10,000 Broadcasts In, They’re Still Live on Air
item.description: Rick Ardon and Susannah Carr have been delivering the news together in Western Australia since 1985 — a Guinness World Record.
item.dc:creator: Katie Robertson and Matthew Abbott

item.title: Quote of the Day: With Packed Clubs and $160 Steaks, Caracas Is Stirring Back to Life
item.description: Quotation of the Day for March 1, 2026.

item.title: In Ukraine, a Community of ‘Simple Believers’ Shuns the Modern World
item.description: The Christians known as viruiuchi prostaky see electricity, cars, higher education and much else as distractions from what really matters.
item.dc:creator: Mauricio Lima and Yurii Shyvala

media:content.media:description: Laying a foundation for a house in the village of Kosmyryn, in western Ukraine, in November.

item.title: Christina Applegate’s New Memoir Is Furious, Funny and Profane
item.description: Funny, furious and profane, “You With the Sad Eyes” finds the TV star facing childhood trauma and reflecting on the limits imposed by illness.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Egan

media:content.media:credit: John Shearer/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Though she has retired from acting, Christina Applegate (here in front of her home) appeared onstage at the Emmy Awards in 2024.

item.title: Corrections: March 1, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, March 1, 2026.

item.title: Trump Stays Out of Public View After U.S. Launches Military Assault on Iran
item.description: President Trump did not deliver a formal address to the American public to explain why the country was at war, a departure from his predecessors.
item.dc:creator: Zolan Kanno-Youngs

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump arriving in Palm Beach, Fla., on Friday.

item.title: Iran Launches Retaliatory Strikes Against Israel and U.S. Bases
item.description: After a series of attacks by the United States and Israel on Saturday, Iran retaliated, striking several countries in the Middle East that host U.S. bases.
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Silva and Devon Lum
item.category: US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)

media:content.media:credit: Avishag Shaar-Yashuv for The New York Times

item.title: Iranians Take to Streets to Celebrate Khamenei’s Death
item.description: Some Iranians said on social media that they were privately mourning the supreme leader. But displays of exuberance broke out in cities across the country.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi and Christiaan Triebert

item.title: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Hard-Line Cleric Who Made Iran a Regional Power, Is Dead at 86
item.description: As Iran’s second supreme leader, he brutally crushed dissent at home and expanded Iran’s footprint abroad, challenging Saudi Arabia for regional dominance.
item.dc:creator: Alan Cowell and Farnaz Fassihi
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who ruled for more than three decades, shaped Iran’s Islamic revolution far more than the Islamic Republic’s founder, Ayatollah Khomeini.

item.title: After Iran Attacks, Ship Traffic Plummets in Strait of Hormuz
item.description: One of the world’s most vital maritime arteries saw a 70 percent drop in vessel traffic.
item.dc:creator: Christiaan Triebert and Alexander Cardia
item.category: US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)

item.title: Iranian Americans in L.A. Find Hope in U.S.-Israeli Strikes on Iran
item.description: Californians of Iranian descent said they welcomed the possible end of an oppressive government in Tehran that their families had fled.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler
item.category: US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)

media:content.media:credit: Caroline Brehman/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators in Los Angeles on Saturday wave flags and march in celebration of the U.S. and Israeli strikes on Iran.

item.title: At the Pentagon, OpenAI is In and Anthropic Is Out
item.description: It’s been a crazy 48 hours in the A.I. industry.

item.title: Death of Girl From Los Angeles School Investigated as a Homicide, Police Say
item.description: The Los Angeles police did not offer details on the death of a student at Reseda High School, but a family said that a 12-year-old girl attending the school died after being struck with a water bottle.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk

item.title: Who Could Take Over for Ayatollah Ali Khamenei?
item.description: Now that Iran has declared that its supreme leader is dead, it is unclear which of his possible successors might rise.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi

item.title: Trump Decision to Strike Iran Opens Fissures in Midterms
item.description: Republicans largely supported the decision, while Democrats mostly opposed it — but divisions appeared in both parties.
item.dc:creator: Tim Balk

media:content.media:credit: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump on Friday. Across the country Saturday, midterm candidates released a flurry of videos, social media posts and statements responding to news of the strikes.

item.title: Trump Tells Iranians to ‘Take Over’ Their Government. But How?
item.description: President Trump’s ambiguous appeal comes after he undermined U.S.-funded media outlets that normally would have helped the administration reach people inside the country.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski
item.category: US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)
United States Agency for Global Media

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Critics say that the Trump administration’s cuts to government-funded broadcasting have hurt the United States’ ability to reach the Iranian people.

item.title: Regime Change in Iran? 4 Opinion Writers on Khamenei Strike.
item.description: How should Americans feel about the potential for regime change? What happens now?

item.title: The Man Who Destroyed Iran
item.description: The supreme leader organized his existence around one big idea: resistance.

item.title: Joe Randall, Chef Who Celebrated Black Cooking Traditions, Dies at 79
item.description: He helped bring the African American cooking of the Carolina Lowcountry to the world and became known as the “dean of Southern Cuisine.”
item.dc:creator: Clay Risen

media:content.media:credit: Josh Galemore/Imagn Images
media:content.media:description: Chef Joe Randall, executive chef and owner of his self-titled cooking school, in 2016. “He made it clear that Black foodways are foundational to American cuisine, not a footnote to it,” the chef Marcus Samuelsson said.

item.title: Guess What Trump Values Above the Constitution
item.description: The State of the Union was very revealing.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie

media:content.media:credit: Damon Winter/The New York Times

item.title: Trump, the Self-Declared Peace President, Goes to War Seeking Regime Change
item.description: President Trump has become increasingly willing to assert American power overseas, a decade after propelling himself to the highest office by promising to focus on “America first.”
item.dc:creator: Peter Baker
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)

media:content.media:credit: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A decade after propelling himself to the highest office by promising to focus on “America first,” President Trump has become increasingly willing to assert power overseas.

item.title: A War of Choice Does Not Make Us Safer
item.description: “The first mission of a president is to keep Americans safe,” says Times columnist Nicholas Kristof following the United States and Israel’s military strike against Iran Saturday. “In this case I fear that President Trump, by embarking on a war of choice, has made us less safe and may be putting Americans at risk for months or years to come.”
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Kristof and Stephanie Shen
item.category: US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)

item.title: How the BAFTAs Bungled Its Response to a Racial Slur
item.description: The awards show didn’t mention racist slurs when it told the audience that a man with Tourette’s might make “involuntarily noises.”
item.dc:creator: Alex Marshall
item.category: British Academy of Film and Television

media:content.media:credit: Scott A Garfitt/Invision, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: The executive producer of the BAFTAs ceremony said that one racist slur was edited from the BBC’s broadcast but that another was missed.

item.title: How Wesley Hunt of Texas Is Working in Plain Sight With Outside Groups
item.description: Exchanges between two X accounts appear to offer a vivid example of how campaigns may sidestep campaign-finance law to share strategic information.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher

media:content.media:credit: Tamir Kalifa for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Wesley Hunt, center, at a watch party for the State of the Union address Tuesday night in Georgetown, Texas.

item.title: Only 21% of Americans Support the United States Initiating an Attack on Iran
item.description: The public’s appetite for a U.S. attack on Iran was low before President Trump and Israel took action on Saturday.

item.title: The Outlook Is Grim for a Freer Iran
item.description: U.S. military interventions have often gone poorly for the countries in question. But there is much the world, and Iranians, can do.

item.title: Ed Iskenderian, Hot Rod Pioneer Known as the ‘Camfather,’ Dies at 104
item.description: “His influence can be felt in every form of motorsport today,” Car and Driver magazine wrote of the man who powered some of the fastest cars of his era with his innovative engine camshafts.
item.dc:creator: Jeré Longman

item.title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Justifications for Attacking Iran
item.description: The president made unsupported and exaggerated claims in a speech announcing the attack on Iran.

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump after delivering remarks in Corpus Christi, Texas, on Friday.

item.title: Middle East Airspace Closes as U.S.-Israeli Strikes Hit Iran
item.description: A major hub in Dubai has suspended operations following U.S.-Israeli strikes on Iran. The sweeping closures are stranding passengers.
item.dc:creator: Christine Chung

media:content.media:credit: Ben Stansall/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: The check-in desk for Emirates airline at London Gatwick Airport on Saturday. The airline announced that all operations to and from Dubai had been paused.

item.title: Israel Targeted Top Iranian Leaders in Attack’s Opening Strikes
item.description: At least one gathering of senior officials and military leaders was hit, but it was not immediately clear whether the effort to kill them had succeeded.
item.dc:creator: Abdi Latif Dahir and Aaron Boxerman
item.category: US and Israeli Attack on Iran (2026)

item.title: Oil Shipments in Persian Gulf Already Disrupted by Iran Attack
item.description: Tankers have begun to steer clear of the region and the Strait of Hormuz, threatening to push up energy prices.

item.title: No Clear Endgame in the Conflict Between Afghanistan and Pakistan
item.description: Pakistan’s airstrikes in Afghanistan showed its overwhelming superiority in conventional warfare, but the Taliban have refined a lethal repertoire of guerrilla tactics.
item.dc:creator: Elian Peltier

media:content.media:credit: Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Pakistani airstrikes threatened to inflict major damage on cities in Afghanistan, which was already reeling from economic hardship and a humanitarian crisis.

item.title: A Sports Frenzy for the Most Valuable Influencers
item.description: To reach young audiences raised on social media, leagues are giving content creators access to marquee moments.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Morgan

media:content.media:credit: Loren Elliott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: More people watched a flag-football game that featured content creators like Druski and was shown on YouTube than the Pro Bowl with actual N.F.L. superstars.

item.title: Demna Struts Into Gucci
item.description: The big debut of Milan Fashion Week sure had a lot of oomph. But will that be enough to turn Gucci’s business around?
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

media:content.media:credit: Daniele Venturelli/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: The beefcake angel wears Gucci.

item.title: Trump’s Unilateral Iran Strike Sparks Constitutional War Powers Dispute
item.description: Critics say the president is violating the Constitution, and many Democrats and at least two Republicans in Congress say they must vote on whether to enter such a conflict.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump himself described the attack as “major combat operations” that could result in American casualties.

item.title: Iran Says Supreme Leader Killed in U.S.-Israeli Strikes
item.description: The death of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei raised questions about leadership succession as attacks on Iran, and its responses, continued.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
